posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.74.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Just in time for autumn, the new “Leafless Tree” emoji (along with the other six new emoji in Unicode 16.0) are now supported in Signal Desktop.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.73.0-beta.2…v7.74.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

New Version: 7.74.0-beta.1

57 new commits since 7.73.0-beta.2:

Show commits

  • v7.74.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Initial Poll message receive support [2]

  • Fix storybook [3]

  • Update to ringrtc v2.58.1 [4]

  • Final fixes for storybook after ESM prep [5]

  • Update icon in MediaPermissionsModal [6]

  • Allow empty inviteeAci field when importing GroupInvitationDeclinedUpdate update messages [7]

  • Allow hardcoding a captcha response in the config files [8]

  • Qualify CJS-only module imports [9]

  • Toast on main process errors [10]

  • Improve delivery receipt processing [11]

  • Fix suggested names for saved attachments [12]

  • Fix attachment ciphertext size calculations for backup tier downloads [13]

  • Update handling of aborted attachment download jobs [14]

  • Upgrade libsignal to v0.81.1, enable websocket compression via remote config [15]

  • Show ready-to-download documents in media gallery [16]

  • Limit unnecessary thumbnail generation [17]

  • Fail mock test runs if tests fail [18]

  • readSync mock test: look for visibility of last item [19]

  • Fix attachment backfill mock tests [20]

  • Add calling test that exercises virtual audio [21]

  • Fix lightbox mock tests [22]

  • Release notes for 7.73 [23]

  • Update strings [24]

  • Update DNS fallback [25]

  • Update minimum macOS version to match Electron 38 [26]

  • Fix the remaining PNP mock tests [27]

  • Add min OS version check to CI [28]

  • Update symbols font [29]

  • Fix link previews for messages with emojis [30]

  • Fix string value for all media button [31]

  • Better draft attachment management logic [32]

  • Avoid logging an error when weakly referenced attachment is missing [33]

  • Improve getUnusedFilename parsing [34]

  • Read-only Poll UI [35]

  • [signalapp/Signal-Desktop#7496] Respect user-entered file extension when saving [36]

  • Separate out experimental and production remote config for permessageDeflate [37]

  • Update electron to 38.2.0 [38]

  • Fix tailwind sources and prefers-contrast theme [39]

  • Update outgoing message size calculation [40]

  • Internationalize backup cost string [41]

  • Fix closure of libsignal socket on reconnect [42]

  • Fix styles for ordered lists after css reset [43]

  • Test safeStorage in Flatpak environments [44]

  • Introduce kyber pre key triple table [45]

  • Mitigate macOS 26 performance issues [46]

  • Ensure file permissions when building for Linux and set sha length for test builds [47]

  • Add transaction support to kyber triples [48]

  • Simplify get-jumbomoji script [49]

  • Update emoji-datasource to 16.0.0 [50]

  • Update accounting of backed up attachments [51]

  • Remove last use of Buffer in ringrtc API [52]

  • Update jumbomoji to version 12 [53]

  • Speed up TypeScript type checking [54]

  • Release notes for 7.74 [55]

  • Update strings [56]

  • 7.74.0-beta.1 [57]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.73.0-beta.2…v7.74.0-beta.1

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

At least 67 languages changed since 7.73.0-beta.2:

For technical reasons, not all languages may be listed below. However, everything from “Updated language translations” and similar commits is listed, so the list is likely complete. You can view the full comparison to 7.73.0-beta.2 so far here.

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Reference for viability after previous thread was closed

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.73 release Desktop Beta Feedback
Is this a bug or a leftover from when image previews from links where still considered to be attachments and listed as such? [grafik] This area says “media, links, files” Media and files have a tab each, links dont. Plus the image previews arent in the media section either anymore Leftover outdated wording or bug?

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.73 release

posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked: Thanks for that report, we saw it and have fixed it!

posts.name: ClauZ
posts.cooked:
Question… how is the remote backup supposed to work for desktop ?

For example, if I have a phone number that had paid remote backups enabled on Android, and I uninstall Signal on Android, but continue to use Signal on Desktop… should the remote backup be updated with the content from the desktop ?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I sent a story from desktop and it sent it to someone that was removed from my contacts on Android

Why aren’t these contacts removed outright so I’m not inadvertently sending content to contacts that are “removed”?

Kind of feels bad that the person probably also has my profile key as well as my updated profile image now

The worst part probably is that Desktop doesn’t even show that I’ve sent it to that contact and that contact isn’t even visible for sending. But I just noticed that it says I have 116 contacts instead of the 115 I have on Android.

I know they’ve received it because they’ve replied to the story.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.74.0-beta.1/80b2e6811ae19f5dbd1a633840c087b8f1b1eada8d44ed172ba2c10ec139bc00.gz
the closing button of sticker pack preview (seen when clicking on a received sticker for example) doesn’t work - need to click outside of the dialogue to close it

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Unable to initiate a call from desktop

Neither chat interface nor call tab works

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.73.0/b888752fda982f67358b5edf07a1455a8e20f9d0b04e7e9ed2d43bc242ca1213.gz

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Any updates on this? I’m also seeing this strange behavior on stable now. I’ve also noticed that Desktop and Android don’t seem to be syncing contacts appropriately. On Desktop I have way more contacts on my new chat page than on Android.

And when sending from stable I’m also seeing the same behavior where it sends to people I don’t have in my Signal Connections. I’ve counted 7 Unknown Contacts (Display name) that don’t show up anywhere as well. I cannot find these 7 Unknown Contacts within my Signal Connections when looking for them.

Whatnoww:

removed from my contacts on Android

Do you mean this contact was removed from your Android system contacts (contacts app) or removed from the Signal contacts (within the Signal app itself)?

I keep having a bug where if I block and delete a Signal contact (spammer, not on my system contacts), they still show up on desktop and I have to (re)delete them on desktop.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
They were only ever in my Signal contacts due to an accidental contact from their end. I simply removed them as a Signal Connection after we finished the conversation, since a block wasn’t warranted.

So they aren’t in my Android system contacts, and they aren’t in my Signal Connections because I removed them from my contacts list within Signal.

posts.name: Yash Aggarwal
posts.cooked: @Whatnoww we’re looking into this. Same question as @DonDino , did you remove from system contacts or within the Signal app? Thank you for the report. EDIT: just saw your reply, thank you. I’ll update when I have more information.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: They were only ever in my Signal app because they accidentally contacted me. So it was only removed from within Signal because that’s the only place they were.

posts.name: Yash Aggarwal
posts.cooked:
Thank you for the report! I’ve been investigating and have a few questions:

  1. Not sure if you’ve deleted the chat as well, but did you see a “you have removed this contact” message on Desktop when you went back to the chat?
  2. If you look at the story “info” on each device, do you see that the hidden contact has “seen” your story on either device? If so, which one?

Feel free to shoot a DM!
